it.unifi.rc.httpserver.m5951907.message

Class HTTPMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unifi.rc.httpserver.m5951907.message.HTTPMessage
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MyHTTPReply, MyHTTPRequest

    public abstract class HTTPMessage
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that abstract common characteristics of HTTP messages.
    Author:
    Simone Cipriani, 5951907

      • HTTPMessage

        private HTTPMessage(java.lang.String header,
                    java.lang.String body)
        Construct an HTTP message specifying the header fields in a string container.
        Parameters:
        header - ensemble of header fields in message
        body - of the message, the payload

      • HTTPMessage

        HTTPMessage(java.lang.String firstLine,
            java.lang.String header,
            java.lang.String body)
     throws HTTPProtocolException
        Construct an HTTP message which encapsulate all the overhead information, depending on the message subtype.
        Parameters:
        firstLine - of the full message
        header - a String object containing the whole lot of header lines
        body - as the payload of the message
        Throws:
        HTTPProtocolException - if the first line or the header lines container could not be parsed

                         throws HTTPProtocolException
        Parse the string container of the message header to initialize the Map encapsulating the header fields.
        Parameters:
        header - lines String container
        Throws:
        HTTPProtocolException - if poor syntax is found

      • getCustomException

        abstract MyHTTPProtocolException getCustomException(java.lang.String verboseMsg)
        Should be implemented by subclasses to specify the parameters they wants during instantiation of MyHTTPProtocolException.
        Parameters:
        verboseMsg - as a verbose description of the condition causing the exception
        Returns:
        the MyHTTPProtocolException object, ready to be thrown

        abstract java.lang.String recomposeFirstLine()
        Merge the first line parameters, recomposing the first line as it originally was. Utility method for the toString override implementation.
        Returns:
        the recomposed first line of the message
